results.full_text: what's up guys welcome to g whiskey my name is jeff this is a channel where i offer my thoughts and opinions on a specific whisky and if you stick around to the end i'll be giving it a score as well that sounds interesting hit subscribe down below and with that out of the way why don't we jump into our review today we're looking at a classic we've got the lagavulin 16. stick around [Music] i don't know why it took me so long to get around to a review of this one this one is like this should be in your first five videos if you're trying to break into the whiskey youtuber scene um it's a legend it's a classic all of you know it most of you probably love it like of all in 16. this bad boy's been around since 1988 it's part of diageo's classic malts range and this bottle is probably one of the most famous ambassadors for isle of whiskey that we have out there uh which is kind of interesting because it's different this is very different from a lot of the other isle of big boys stuff like your art bags or your laphroaigs and that's because this stuff is softer it's gentler it's calmer we do get peat and smoke in here but it's more rounded it's more refined than what we'll get with most of the other isla offerings for better or for worse um and you know of course a lot of people do turn to isle of whiskey's because they want that more rugged punch your character but this one is definitely one of your more pretty isla offerings and it's worth noting that that applies to our 16 specifically the eight-year-old the 12 year old cast strength those are about as rough and tumble as any other isla out there uh but our 16 here has built its reputation on being very accessible it's great for people who are maybe beginners or just getting started with the isle of flavor profiles it's a great stepping stone into that world but it's also like layered and complex enough that a lot of seasoned whiskey drinkers can get behind it too and you know i've always liked it precisely because it is a more refined and calmer option from isla traditionally there haven't been two too many of those there's definitely like a gentlemanly appeal to this it's not as loud or as intense or as rugged or as scrappy as art bags or laphroaig's part of that is due to the lower abv which it does get criticized for i mean rightly so and it also gets criticized for being not quite as good as it used to be back in the day but to be fair i mean that's the kind of thing that people say about pretty much every whiskey out there sometimes it's true sometimes it isn't us whiskey drinkers can be a nostalgic bunch for sure so let's see if this is as good as the lager from the good old days let's see if this dinosaur is still competitive in today's market let's jump into our review see what our whisky is all about and in the meantime if you could kindly leave a like down below that'd be greatly appreciated well we do have a diageo product here so we can expect to be underwhelmed our abv comes in at 43 it is going to be chill filtered it is a colored whiskey um you know disappointing yes absolutely surprising no tinted bottle here so we can't make out the color of our whiskey um i love like a villain bottles i think they look fantastic i like that they haven't really updated or changed the look in a really long time i do feel like the look of the bottle kind of suits the whiskey that we've got inside it's got a restrained old-school kind of gentlemanly elegance to it a wonderful bottle so i'm going to give this maybe four and a half out of five obviously they're not going to brag about being colored or chill filtered why would they diago in general though is pretty famous for sharing next to nothing when it comes to stuff like production information or just useful information in general it's annoying i suppose we should expect at this point um yeah it's still a great bottle though i did not add water let's try our nose uh sweet soft refined we have pete and sherry in equal measure here both very gentle seamlessly integrated we have some minerals some rooibos tea um some oysters a little bit of grenadine we have sea air we have himalayan rock salt we have like ribs slathered in like a sweet barbecue sauce maybe some some sliced oranges in there classic lagging nose let's try the palette very easy arrival um pete comes on first uh bonfire bonfire logs bonfire smoke embers um black pepper grilled meat definitely some leather in here there's also some candied fruit like candied apple candied strawberries some maraschino cherries and now we're finished all right um gets fruitier and drier here more maraschino cherries um i'm picturing one of those fancy dark chocolate bars with like bits of chili in it i also have bits of fruit bits of almonds too there's also smoke earth leather and autumn leaves our finish is medium in length well this one is still a classic um there's not a lot about this whiskey that i don't like um it's got all the elements that made it a classic it's got that grown up gentlemanly character uh i've previously referred to this whiskey as the ultimate fireside whiskey i still think that's true i imagine myself sitting on an antique leather armchair in my study next to the fireplace um i don't have a study or a fireplace and anyway i'm sipping on this i'm reading a good book and i'm listening to the fire crackle in the background and i have a mustache now this is not a whiskey that you're going to feed to someone if you want to like blow them away with intensity um i mean you know i guess for the uninitiated who are just getting into pete this one is going to have like big peat and it's going to feel punchy and very smoky but i think if you've had enough pete this one will be relatively tame um there's definitely a lot of much more aggressively peated whiskies out there and i like it for that i like the vibe that this whiskey gives me it's got that special quality it takes me somewhere uh that being said it's not perfect there are some areas that we can definitely improve upon here and that's not really lag of owen's fault that's more diageo's fault i think the intrinsic quality of our whiskey here is fantastic it's absolutely brimming with flavor honestly more flavor than it has any right having it just 43 uh that being said at 43 it is a little light in the body it definitely should be 46. um also i think the the mutterings from like the whiskey curmudgeons out there might actually be right on this one i also kind of think yeah this one was better back in the day you know memory can be a little bit dicey at times so i'm not totally convinced this used to be a lot better than it is now um the flavors the profile it's all pretty much the same but i do seem to remember a little bit more maybe depth or nuance to the older versions so yeah i think the lag of one 16s of yesteryear had a little bit more complexity and i would need a side by side to confirm that but yeah i do feel like this one is a little bit simpler that being said it's still a damn fine pour it's still a whiskey i'm always happy to come back to so i'm gonna give this one a score of 86. older ones probably would have been 88. so we've got a charming approachable unique fruity profile here we have stuff like bonfire notes embers cherries oranges i don't think i've ever not enjoyed drinking like a villain 16. uh nostalgia might be a factor there but no i mean it's good it's a good whiskey um also what other peated isla distillery is giving us affordable age-stated whiskies these days i guess there's laphroaig with the 16. definitely some bulmores fine there's a few but there should be more um regardless this is an excellent whiskey again it's got very broad appeal it's one that beginners can get behind as well as seasoned old timers like myself so it's definitely one to try if you haven't i think most experienced single malt whiskey drinkers will have tried this one before but if you're new if you're just getting into whiskey if you want to dip your tone into those temperamental isle of waters definitely check this one out it's a classic it's a rite of passage our value here is okay i'm not going to say it's great it has climbed in price quite a bit over the last few years in my market it's not super expensive for a 16 year old but it's not particularly cheap either there was a time that this was among the cheaper 16 year olds you could buy and that's definitely no longer the case still this is a bottle i'm gonna suggest you pick up maybe split one um listen our specs are weak here the prices have been climbing over the last few years this is not a bottle that's going to be worth it forever for the time being while the price is still somewhat reasonable it's worth trying you have to experience this one at least once all right that's gonna be it for me today guys thank you very much for watching if you want to help support the channel please consider becoming a patron otherwise like comment and subscribe always appreciated i do want to hear from you have you tried our lag of all in 16 here what were your thoughts finally down below in the comments let me know you want to see me review next i'll keep it in mind for my upcoming videos bye guys you
